intro: Webera wrayi, commonly known as the African nettle, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Urticaceae family, which includes many species known for their stinging hairs. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with opposite, ovate leaves that have a rough texture. Its small, greenish-white flowers are clustered in dense inflorescences, and it produces small, three-lobed fruits. Webera wrayi is often found in moist, shaded areas and is used in traditional medicine for its potential healing properties.
